physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum PRL level of 51 mg/L (normal, <15); MRI demonstrated a less enhancing macroadenoma in the pituitary region.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After surgery, her menstrual periods resumed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum PRL level of 84 mg/L; MRI demonstrated a less enhancing mass lesion, confirmed as a PRL-secreting pituitary adenoma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum PRL level decreased to about 2.4 mg/L 2 months after initiation of bromocriptine therapy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum intact PTH and calcium levels slightly increased; Sonographic imaging detected a likely parathyroid tumor of 12 mm; CT scan showed a pancreatic tumor of 20 mm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum levels of intact PTH and calcium increased compared to previous levels.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Skull roentgenograms revealed enlargement of the sella turcica and destruction of the dorsum sella.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued treatment with bromocriptine for 12 years; later developed bitemporal hemianopsia.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum PRL level of 56 mg/L; Dynamic MRI demonstrated a microadenoma in the pituitary gland; Serum intact PTH level slightly increased.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Asymptomatic 2 years later; slight increase in serum intact PTH level noted.
